catalog_description.title: Demo Course
catalog_description.blurb: A quick introduction to this e-learning platform.
catalog_description.overview: This course gives you a quick introduction to this e-learning platform. We'll brief you on how to take a course, use the navigation and interact in the forum.

block.html_content:
We're going to introduce you to the basics of taking a course on this e-learning platform. But don't worry, there's no pressure and it won't take lots of time. We'll give you just enough info so you can start one of our real courses. The whole demo course will probably take about thirty minutes, tops.

We built this platform from the ground up to provide you with a simple, clean and effective learning environment.

Even though this course is a demo, you should still try to finish this it, because if you do you'll get a very fancy, very printable certificate of achievement. Who doesn't like certificates of achievement?

"Oh great," you say. "One more website navigation system to figure out." But don't worry, we've tried to keep our navigation system as simple as possible.

Two Navigation Bars

There are two different navigation areas you should know about. Once you've got a handle on those, you should be able to navigate between top-level areas on this site as well access content and features specific to a course you might be viewing.

This a diagram showing you where the two main navigation bars appear on the KinesinLMS website:

  1. Top navigation bar: This nav bar helps you get around all of KinesinLMS..
  2. Courses navigation bar: You will only see this navigation bar once you've enrolled in and started a course. It provides access to features within that course.

When you visit this site, you'll immediately see a list of courses we're offering at the moment. They're listed in the front page just beneath the marketing image.

Each course is listed in its own card:

In a course, you step through "units" of content, where a unit is a single page of content. A unit can include text, videos, assessments and so on.

Units are grouped into sections and sections grouped into modules. You click the "Course" tab in the course navigation bar to start viewing this content. If you've viewed this course before, you'll be placed in the last unit you viewed. Otherwise you'll start at the first unit in the course.

You can now step through each unit with the forward and backward arrows on the right side of the screen.

Meanwhile, you have two options if you want to see a summary of the course contents:

  • Course contents nav button: clicking this button shows a slide-out navigation bar on the left side of the screen with a list of all modules, sections and units in the course.
  • Course contents "quick nav" button: clicking this button to show the course in a navigable grid.

KinesinLMS uses the YouTube video player for displaying videos. Here's a quick recap of the controls for a desktop browser (if you're using a mobile browser the user interface might look slightly different).

Example Video

Here's a live example of the video player. It's a video from iBiology about the Amazonian rainforest. Feel free to experiment with video controls.

Below you'll find an example of a simple text entry assessment. This kind of assessement allows the student to enter simple text. Go ahead and type something and submit it. When you hit Submit you'll see a small green check, meaning your answer has been saved.

If you want to go back and change your response, you can. Just start typing in the text area and you'll see the Submit button become enabled. When you're finished making changes, just click the Submit button again to save your changes.

assessment.question: What kinds of courses would you like to see on KinesinLMS?

block.html_content:
When taking a course, you'll often encounter assessments that test your knowledge with simple multiple choice questions. 

An example of one is below. Give it a try.

assessment.question: Which scientist coined the term “cells” from microscopic observations of slices of cork?

block.html_content:
Another type of assessment you might encounter is an "interactive table." In this type of assessment, you'll be asked to fill out a table with information, which might include adding new rows for additional information.

An example of an interactive table is shown below.

simple_interactive_tool.name: Example Interactive Table
simple_interactive_tool.instructions: Create a list of your favorite restaurants and their best dishes.

block.html_content:
Another assessment interaction you'll encounter is a "diagram" assessment, where you're asked to create a diagram explaining a concept or expressing an idea in a visual way.

Shown below is a simple form of this "Interactive Diagram" assessment. Try dragging out some shapes and connecting them. It's easy!

simple_interactive_tool.name: Interactive Diagram
simple_interactive_tool.instructions: Try dragging out a couple shapes and connecting them.

definition.tray_instructions: Drag and drop the nodes to create a workflow

block.html_content:
At certain times you'll be asked to complete a task outside the course platform, and then indicate you've done it. 

Below is an example of a "Done" indicator that allows you to mark that you've completed a task. Go ahead and click it.

assessment.question: Click the checkbox to indicate you've completed the task.

block.html_content:
When It's Time to Discuss...

When it's time to discuss various topics in a course with your fellow students, you'll use the discussion forum. The discussion forum gives you a way to post questions or comments under a topic or respond to another student's post.

KinesinLMS uses the powerful forum software created by Discourse to power our discussion forum. Discourse provides a new user guide for people using their forum, but our own instructions here should be enough to get you going. ( You can always check the Discourse new user guide to get more details on a forum feature. )

Inline Discussion Prompt

Individual discussion topics are embedded directly in the course content (see image below). You can review the current posts in this topic directly in the unit. If you're ready to contribute, you simply click the "Join the discussion" button to jump to the topic in the forum where you can add your own thoughts. A new browser window will open the discussion forum, set to the current topic. Watch the video above for a few tips on the user interface you'll use in the discussion forum

You can also use the "Forum Topics" tab in the Course navigation bar to get a list of links to each discussion topic available in the course. Clicking a link will take you to that topic in the forum.

Now that you know how the discussion prompts work, take a moment to review the current responses to the "e-Learning Course Experience" topic shown in the discussion prompt widget below. (Note that the discussion prompt widget allows you to scroll through the current responses without having to opening the forum.)

Then, click the "Join the discussion" button to contribute your own thoughts to the discussion in the forum!
Have you taken an online course before? If so, what was your experience?

As you go along in a course, you'll be asked to complete tasks, write short entries, and perhaps even answer some assessment questions. Depending on the course, completing some or all of those tasks may be required in order to receive a certificate.

To view your current progress towards completion, you can click the the Progress tab in the course navigation bar. This page will show all tasks required and your progress towards each.

Everybody loves getting a certificate. And you so will you when you successfully complete certain courses on KinesinLMS. 

You will earn a certificate as soon as you successfully finish enough tasks to complete the course. Each course has its own requirements for completion...check the progress tab to see how you're doing.

When you've met the requirements to pass the course, the certificate tab will show you an html-version of your certificate. To get a PDF version, simply print that page and save to PDF. (The page is formatted to print on a single page.)

You're finished!

That's right. You should be ready now to take one of our courses.

If you have any issues using the system, don't hesitate to contact us.
